title: Exercise Tracking with MET Calculations
description: Exercise logging with activity type selection, duration input, and automatic calorie burn calculation using MET (Metabolic Equivalent of Task) values. Track both cardio and strength training with appropriate calculations.

phases.name: Core Services Layer
phases.description: Build the foundational services for exercise calorie calculation and data management

subtasks.title: Create ExerciseCalcService for MET-based calorie calculation
subtasks.description: Implement the service that calculates calories burned using MET values. Formula: Calories = MET × weight(kg) × duration(hours). MET values vary by exercise type and are adjusted by intensity multiplier (low: 0.8, medium: 1.0, high: 1.2).
acceptance_criteria: calculateCaloriesBurned(exerciseType, duration, intensity, weight) returns Int32
Applies intensity multiplier from Intensity enum
Converts duration from minutes to hours for calculation
Handles edge cases (zero duration, zero weight)
subtasks.notes: Successfully implemented ExerciseCalcService with calculateCaloriesBurned method. Uses MET formula (Calories = MET × weight × duration/60), applies intensity multipliers (0.8, 1.0, 1.2), handles edge cases (zero duration/weight), and returns rounded Int32 result.

subtasks.title: Create ExerciseRecordRepository for Core Data operations
subtasks.description: Implement the repository layer for CRUD operations on ExerciseRecord entities in Core Data. Handles conversion between domain entities and managed objects.
acceptance_criteria: fetchAll(for userId, on date) returns records for a specific date
fetchAll(for userId) returns all records for a user
Proper conversion between domain ExerciseRecord and Core Data ExerciseRecord
subtasks.notes: Successfully implemented ExerciseRecordRepository with full CRUD operations. Includes save() with create/update logic, fetch(by id) for single records, fetchAll(for userId, on date) with proper date comparison (same calendar day), fetchAll(for userId) for all user records, and delete(by id). Proper conversion between domain ExerciseRecord entities and Core Data managed objects with comprehensive error handling via RepositoryError enum.

subtasks.title: Create DailyLogRepository for Core Data operations
subtasks.description: Implement the repository layer for DailyLog entity operations. Supports getOrCreate pattern for automatic DailyLog creation when needed.
acceptance_criteria: getOrCreate(userId, date, defaultBMR, defaultTDEE) returns existing or creates new DailyLog
fetch(by userId, date) returns single DailyLog or nil
update(dailyLog) saves changes to existing DailyLog
subtasks.notes: Successfully implemented DailyLogRepository with getOrCreate pattern for automatic DailyLog creation, fetch(by userId, date) with proper calendar-based date comparison, update(dailyLog) for saving changes, and comprehensive error handling. Follows the established repository pattern with proper conversion between domain entities and Core Data managed objects.

subtasks.title: Create UserRepository for fetching current user data
subtasks.description: Implement repository for User entity to fetch current user and their weight for calorie calculations.
acceptance_criteria: fetchCurrentUser() returns the single User in the app
getCurrentWeight() returns user's currentWeight as Decimal
Handles case when no user exists
subtasks.notes: Successfully implemented UserRepository with fetchCurrentUser() to retrieve the single User in the app and getCurrentWeight() to return user's currentWeight as Decimal. Handles case when no user exists by returning nil. Follows established repository pattern with proper Core Data integration and comprehensive error handling using RepositoryError enum.

subtasks.title: Create ExerciseRecordService with DailyLog cascade updates
subtasks.description: Implement the service layer that handles exercise record business logic and automatically updates DailyLog when exercises are added/modified/deleted.
acceptance_criteria: addExercise() creates ExerciseRecord and updates DailyLog (totalCaloriesOut += calories, exerciseMinutes += duration, exerciseCount += 1)
updateExercise() modifies record and adjusts DailyLog delta
deleteExercise() removes record and decrements DailyLog values
Creates DailyLog if doesn't exist (using DailyLogRepository.getOrCreate)
subtasks.notes: Successfully implemented ExerciseRecordService with full business logic for exercise tracking. Includes addExercise() that creates ExerciseRecord and updates DailyLog (totalCaloriesOut += calories, exerciseMinutes += duration, exerciseCount += 1), updateExercise() that modifies record and adjusts DailyLog delta (handles date changes by updating both old and new DailyLog), and deleteExercise() that removes record and decrements DailyLog values. Uses ExerciseCalcService for MET-based calorie calculation with user's current weight from UserRepository. Creates DailyLog automatically if doesn't exist using DailyLogRepository.getOrCreate pattern. Validates duration >= 1 minute and provides comprehensive error handling via ServiceError enum. All operations maintain transactional consistency.

phases.name: UI Layer - Views and ViewModels
phases.description: Build the user interface components for exercise tracking

subtasks.title: Create ExerciseViewModel for exercise list management
subtasks.description: Implement ViewModel that manages exercise records for display, handles date navigation, and provides data for the exercise list view.
acceptance_criteria: Calculates daily totals (calories, minutes, count) from DailyLog
Provides methods to add, edit, delete exercises
subtasks.notes: Successfully implemented ExerciseViewModel with all required features. Loads exercises for selected date with loadExercises(), supports date navigation (goToPreviousDay, goToNextDay, goToToday), calculates daily totals from DailyLog (totalCaloriesBurned, totalExerciseMinutes, exerciseCount), provides methods to add/edit/delete exercises with async/await pattern, has loading and error state management with @Published properties, and refreshes data after changes automatically. Follows SwiftUI ObservableObject pattern with @MainActor for thread safety.

subtasks.title: Create ExerciseInputViewModel for exercise input form
subtasks.description: Implement ViewModel for the exercise input modal that handles form state, real-time calorie preview calculation, and validation.
acceptance_criteria: Manages form state (exerciseType, duration, intensity, date)
Real-time calorie preview as user changes inputs
Edit mode support for modifying existing records
subtasks.notes: Successfully implemented ExerciseInputViewModel with all required features. Manages form state (exerciseType, duration, intensity, date) with @Published properties, provides real-time calorie preview calculation using ExerciseCalcService with Combine publishers debounced at 300ms, validates duration >= 1 minute with validation messages, implements save action that calls ExerciseRecordService for both create and update operations, supports edit mode with existing record initialization, and sets shouldDismiss flag on successful save to trigger modal dismissal. Follows SwiftUI ObservableObject pattern with @MainActor for thread safety, includes comprehensive error handling, and uses async/await for service calls.

subtasks.title: Create ExerciseListView for displaying daily exercises
subtasks.description: Build the main exercise list view showing exercises for the selected date with date navigation, daily summary, and add button.
acceptance_criteria: Date header with left/right navigation arrows
Today button to jump to current date
Daily summary card (total calories, total minutes, exercise count)
List of exercise cards with type icon, name, duration, calories
subtasks.notes: Successfully implemented ExerciseListView with all required UI features. Includes date navigation header with previous/next/today buttons, daily summary card displaying total calories burned, exercise minutes, and exercise count from DailyLog, exercise list with cards showing type icon, name, duration, intensity, and calories, swipe-to-delete functionality with confirmation alert, tap-to-edit functionality (modal placeholder for ExerciseInputView), floating add button positioned at bottom-right, and empty state view with helpful message. Uses helper methods for exercise type icons (SF Symbols: figure.walk, figure.run, bicycle, etc.), exercise type colors, and intensity icons. Integrates with ExerciseViewModel for data management, loading/error states, and CRUD operations. Includes SwiftUI preview with proper mock dependency injection.

subtasks.title: Create ExerciseInputView modal for adding/editing exercises
subtasks.description: Build the sheet modal for inputting exercise details with exercise type grid, duration picker, intensity selector, and calorie preview.
acceptance_criteria: Exercise type grid with icons and labels for all 8 types
Duration input with stepper or number field (minutes)
subtasks.notes: Successfully implemented ExerciseInputView with all required features. Created sheet modal with exercise type selection grid (8 types with icons: walking, running, cycling, swimming, weight, crossfit, yoga, other), duration input field with +/-10 minute stepper buttons, intensity selector (low/medium/high) with visual indicators and color coding, date picker for selecting exercise date, and real-time calorie burn preview with gradient background. Integrated into ExerciseListView with proper ViewModel creation through makeInputViewModel() helper method. Supports both create mode (new exercise) and edit mode (modify existing record) via ExerciseInputViewModel. Includes form validation (duration >= 1 minute), error handling with alerts, and Save/Cancel buttons with proper state management. All 8 acceptance criteria met.

subtasks.title: Create ExerciseCardView component
subtasks.description: Build a reusable card component for displaying a single exercise record in the list.
subtasks.notes: Successfully implemented ExerciseCardView as a reusable card component for displaying exercise records. Shows exercise type icon with colored circular background (using SF Symbols: figure.walk, figure.run, bicycle, etc.), exercise type name using displayName from ExerciseType enum, duration in minutes with clock icon, intensity level with visual indicators (circle icons for low/medium/high), and calories burned with kcal label. Consistent styling matches ExerciseListView design with rounded corners, shadow effects, and proper spacing. Includes helper methods for icon selection, color mapping by exercise type (green for walking, blue for running, etc.), and intensity icon selection. Includes comprehensive preview with multiple exercise examples. All 6 acceptance criteria met.

subtasks.title: Create ExerciseTypeGridView component
subtasks.description: Build a grid component for selecting exercise type with icons.
acceptance_criteria: Grid layout showing all 8 exercise types
subtasks.notes: Successfully created ExerciseTypeGridView.swift as a reusable component. Implemented 4×2 grid layout displaying all 8 exercise types with SF Symbol icons (figure.walk, figure.run, bicycle, figure.pool.swim, dumbbell.fill, figure.cross.training, figure.yoga, figure.mixed.cardio). Added selection state with visual highlighting (color changes, font weight). Includes accessible tap targets with 50×50pt circular icons. Color-coded by exercise type (green/walking, blue/running, orange/cycling, cyan/swimming, red/weight, purple/crossfit, pink/yoga, gray/other). Extracted from ExerciseInputView for better code reusability. All 4 acceptance criteria met.

subtasks.title: Add SF Symbol icons to ExerciseType enum
subtasks.description: Extend ExerciseType enum to include SF Symbol icon names for each exercise type.
acceptance_criteria: Each ExerciseType has an iconName property returning SF Symbol name

Icons: walking (figure.walk), running (figure.run), cycling (bicycle), swimming (figure.pool.swim), weight (dumbbell.fill), crossfit (figure.cross.training), yoga (figure.yoga), other (figure.mixed.cardio)
